comment: Every Metro Rail station should have a bike station nearby.

In general expanding the current downtown system outwards would increase ridership from people living close to downtown who want to get to downtown. This includes MacArthur Park and Koreatown - both served well by 7th St bike lanes. And USC soon to be served by Figueroa lanes.
Great connection to the red line and a good way to outreach the bike share to the latino community
This is also near a Metro Rail station, which should all have bike stations nearby each front.
Right, but also this is a standalone community that deserves its own services regardless to how it can serve the DTLA community.
Opens up parks to the DTLA community
More bike stops in neighborhoods immediately surrounding downtown. Expand the current network to the residents!
It would be great to have a station near Al and Beas! I would bike there once a week from City Hall.

I work in downtown and I would LOVE to be able to bike to Boyle Heights for lunch in order to exercise and get access to a wider variety of lunch options.  This would enhance the ability of the local businesses in Boyle Heights to attract the downtown lunch crowd because the Little Tokyo station is too far from all the workers to be a feasible way to get to Boyle Heights during a lunch break.
Great choice for a station. Users in Boyle Heights will be able to drop off bikes in Arts District where they work.

I Agree - great connection point to the expo line. All expo and subway stops in coverage zone should have at least one station. This being next to a university, expo line stop, football stadium, soccer stadium, museum and parks should have several nearby for public access.
Great for visiting the museums, USC and the Coliseum.
There NEEDS to be a station at the coliseum. I am so sick of riding the expo line on game day!
Expo line sucks. Always breaks. Full of marigüanos and obscene music. A station here would provide relief
I would use bikeshare between USC and downtown
Bike stations at metro stations encourages metro riding and bike riding
Located near Metro station, connecting University students, faculty, and staff.
I Agree.  Let City workers bike around, fewer cars.
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.
I Agree. Yeah. Here before Venice.
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.

I Agree and another great location would be Wilshire and Vermont as there are a lot of shops there and a new yoga studio will be opening there.  Consider putting new stations along the red and purple line between 7th and metro and wilshire and vermont.
A downtown bike hub would allow for people to ride bikes to shops, bars and stores without worrying about worrying about bike theft. Another location would be echo par/sunset blvd

I agree. The two closest locations (in front of DWP and on corner of Grand Ave and Temple St) are actually in convenient for people who work in the County buildings. This station would be much closer to bus and rail lines and is much more frequently used thoroughfare than the Temple/Grand area.

I Agree. Super useful for jurors who want to head out a little further for lunch without having to move their cars and find/pay for parking elsewhere. Super useful for anyone who works at HOA or the courthouse.

I Agree. I work in the County HOA and while I sometimes take a bike from the rack at the Cathedral at Grand & Temple at the top of the hill, there ought to be a rack at the Metro so I don't have to ride the bike back uphill.
Every Metro Rail station should have a bike station adjacent to at least one of the exit/entry points.
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.
I Agree. near the main bust stop for UCLA students
I Agree, this would be a great location for sure!
This is a great location and close to my apartment, would love this
I Agree, it is close to UCLA and other Blue Bus stops.
I Agree! Culver shopping center here super gray location
I Agree! Culver shopping center here super gray location
As much as possible, bike share stations should be placed at all rail stations.
Next to Metro and needed to get around Palms as long as there are additional drop-off locations.
Definitely makes sense to have a bike share hub at the Palms Expo Line Metro station.
Get off Metro and hop on a Metro Bike - Perfecto!!
I Agree - need to bike to the Metro station!
Bike stations at metro stations encourages metro riding and bike riding
There should definitely be some by the metro
I wish to see the Golden line train continues to the city of Glendora. Thank you. Gougas Ghougassian
I Agree and needs to happen soon
I Agree and needs to happen soon
This is essential with the park now open.
I Agree it is very hard to get to this amazing park from DTLA even though it is so close
Parking is limited - having a station here would be great!
YES! I like this location - please add!
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.
Opens up parks to the DTLA community
Agreed. This would be a great location and enhances connectivity to USC and the MyFig corridor.
I Agree. A lot of popular businesses and breweries.
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.
Very convenient if the gold line has passed already. Very useful
There is a Mariachi goldline station that would complement the metro bike station very well!
I Agree. In case they run out of bikes at the proposed Metro Station location.
It's kind of ridiculous that Grand Park and the subway stations there have no bike stalls nearby.
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.
In or around the row would be great
Definitely need one here considering how car-centric The Row is trying to be.
I Agree, Can't get one there soon enough.
Super important. And I bet the developers wouldn't mind.
I Agree this is very important. There are almost no ways of accessing the row without a car
I Agree. My office is moving here and there will be many other businesses opening up soon.
Agree. Would be good to be able to use bike share from the Little Tokyo Gold Line station to get to Smorgasburg, since DASH doesn't operate this area efficiently on weekends.
Enough bike share locations in Downtown. Please add to Koreatown instead.
All of the LA Parks should have stations.
I Agree.  Bikes in the park!
I Agree connect Silver lake and sunset junction to the red line
I Agree - This is a great location to connect Silver Lake / Sunset Blvd to Red Line station at VT/SM.
Bikes would take some of the residents out of the traffic equation during that time
Would also ease traffic during rush hour in the area. Traffic barely moves around 5/6pm going east and north

Definitely need a station here. Such a major intersection, and super central to get around the nighborhood and better connects the enormous population of Silverlake with other areas, such as Hollywood, koreatown, etc.
Super important to have a station at this intersection of two major bike thoroughfares
A great way to connect Atwater to Frogtown
I Disagree there is too much traffic and congestion in this area, small sidewalks. The bike stop needs space. So it would need to be toward the sunset/vermont station or near Barnsdall park.
I Agree - I do not attend the school, but live on Willow Brook Ave. This is a great place for bike metro to connect EH and Silver Lake to the Red Line.
I work at LACC, Rideshare Coordinator. We have the Red Line Station and Willowbrook entrance of our LACC campus. We need bike sharing for your students and staff.
I Agree, lots of room & lockers at the train stop already, it just makes sense
Seems like there should be bike shares at all metro stops...
I Agree, Great location next to the park
I Agree. This would be an ideal place for a bike station as my kids and I could ride to the meadow and home again.
I Agree. This would be an ideal place for a bike station as my kids and I could ride to the meadow and home again.
The meadow NEEEEEDS a bike station
I like this location. It is across the street from a school, and parents and staff there could use this station.
Every Metro Rail station, especially at stations where multiple transit lines intersect like this one, should have a bike station nearby.
This is a great spot for a bike share station, a key intersection for public transportation along the Vermont & Wilshire corridors.
Ideal spot, near major bus thoroughfares. Can help during Red/Purple maintenance at late hours.
Having bikes here would be great, but there needs to be a safe, newbie-friendly way for bicycles to go from the Wilshire/Vermont station to the 7th St bike lanes.
I agree! A bike share outside of the Red/Purple Line station at Vermont & Wilshire would be great.
Perfect location.  Buss stops, Red line, and one block south is 7th St. which has great bike lanes.
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
Busy intersection with two Main Street and a busy out door pedestrian shopping district.
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
We need more bike share locations in residential areas so people can easily pick up a bike close to where they live.
I Agree... connect Wilshire to Olympic
Wilshire /Western. Major transit stop. Lots of food places; club; bars;  residents without vehicles.  Home zip 90020. Work zip 90010.
Bike stations in Koreatown would make perfect sense. Especially with the current and future Purple Line extension. Many residents would benefit from it.
Yes right by the metro entrance on Wiltshire between Normandie and Ardmore
I Agree, add bike stations to each metro station in Koreatown and MacArthur Park, and add bike stations throughout the neighborhoods.
I support having bike stations at all Metro rail line stations. I'd use this one in particular.
This intersection as well as 3rd Street is busy. It would be great to have makes around this area
Yes!  Santa Monica/Vermont; Beverly/Vermont, Wilshire/Vermont and on down south along major Rapid stops.
Perfect spot for riders needed to go west/south of campus
Would help from misrespectful bicyclists placing bikes illegally on trains. Bicyclists make expo line crappy.
Bikeshare at all Expo Line stations makes sense!!
Bike stations at metro stations encourages metro riding and bike riding
Also need a connection to Vermont Ave.
It would be important to have a bike share station at the Expo line bike hub station.  Please include.
It would be important to have a bike share station at the Expo line bike hub station.  Please include.
I Agree!  Great location for a bike share stop.
A bike station next to the expo/bundy station is a great idea.
I'd like to see a Breeze (Santa Monica) Bikeshare hub here.
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
This is right by UCLA grad housing and would greatly decrease car use in the neighborhood!
Sawtelle is a great neighborhood but not super accessible via publication transit. This would be a great option.
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
I Agree--an important location to connect the train to nearby businesses and other unserved neighborhoods.  It would be great for the bike path too.
As much as possible, bike share stations should be placed at all rail stations.
The expo line would complement this bike station well.
Bike station here would be convenient for commuters that take the train part way or people that would like to enjoy the bike path a long exposition.
i like this location because it helps move people around the entire westwood community north of Wilshire and then they can park or rent bikes in a convenient manner.
I Agree. Help connect to Expo Line.
I Agree connects Westwood to Santa Monica system.
With the influx of people on campus each and every day, UCLA should have as many bike share locations as possible
More locations in Westwood for people to park their bikes make sense in front of residential and commercial properties.
I agree that this location makes sense for people to come from the UCLA campus area and then be able to park their bikes in an area that has theaters, restaurants and farmers markets in the vicinity.
Bike share would be a perfect fit for Virgil Village!
I Agree. Definitely need Metro Bikes along Westwood Blvd. Tons of ppl go to Expo Line and UCLA along this route daily. Get them on bikes and out of cars!
Great location to link Westwood station to nearby businesses and UCLA.
Near Westside Pavillion, Expo Line stop, and commuter path to UCLA
Next to bike lanes.  Could connect neighborhoods for Westwood, Century City area to expo line.
Bikes near WW Expo Line Station please!
Need some here and into Westwood, Century City and West LA.
good location because it is close to expo line and bike path
Close to shopping and lots of dense housing.
Farmers market located here on weekends. Lots of great small restaurants to ride to and support.
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
Please make bike share stations automatic at all rail stations
Makes sense to put a bike share hub at the Expo Line Metro station.
Bike stations at metro stations encourages metro riding and bike riding
Also near the WeWork. +1 for a station
Bike share options at all expo line stations please!
Farmdale Station, Farmdale is a low-traffic roadway which would be conducive to bicycling to points north and south.
You should also have one by the baldwin mall
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
Bike stations at metro stations encourages metro riding and bike riding
Expo stop and future end to the new Crenshaw Line. Need a station here for people to ride to the USC area.
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
This would be a great spot for a location
I Agree RNA San Pedro CicLAvia vinyl
Bikeshare at Expo Line stations are a no-brainer
This is a very rich strip of restaurants and cafes, there should be stations along here.
Good choice right near the library
This location is approximately a mile from the Western/Exposition Expo Line. A location here would be great for first mile/last mile connections to Expo and soon Crenshaw/LAX.
I Agree, I want to go west on Pico to Hauser or further to Fairfax on Pico. Can we get tbikes there too?
This would be a great location because it is already a metro bus transportation hub.  More and more shopping is also appearing at this intersection.
Busy area. Lots of residents. Near shopping, banking, restaurants.
this is the boundary of the weho bike share area - could switch locations here and continue south east to expo line
This would be really close to Metro rail and bus. Both are great options to get to Hollywood and then go for a bike ride.
That intersection would be great for bikeshare.  Berendo and Westmoreland are bike friendly streets, but need signage directing riders to wilshire/vermont and macarthur park.
I Agree -. It's also next to whittiers only dog park
Great location that is close to Hollywood proper
I Agree. Hollywood Western stop gets a lot of traffic
should be obvious to metro to include stations at all rail stations. an easy solution to the first and last mile problem
Great location as it's close to Griffith Park.
I AgreeDefinitely need a station at Wilshire and Vermont and/or 7th and vermont.
6th Street could become a great corridor for cycleing north of Wilshire. It's relatively flat compared to Beverly and could replicate the 7th Street bike lanes.
some bike infrastructure around this area would be nice. so people feel safe on bikes in the city
should be a no brainer for metro to include bike portals at all rail stations
It's important to have stations in neighborhoods and not just along commercial corridors. This way people can pick one up close to where they live.
Love it! Near groceries and shopping
I Agree.  Next to Culver Hotel, across from Main Street and Farmer's Market.  Great locationl
This is a good place for a bike rack
I Agree, would love this spot
I Agree perfect for connecting to Palm and metro stop!!!!!! So so so helpful for commuting to expo!!!
access to the park and Ballona Creek Bike Path
This is convenient to the Culver City Park, plus it's near an entrance to the Ballona Creek bike path.
I Agree. Solves last mile problem to get to recreation/fitness activity from expo line

The Baldwin Scenic Overlook is a popular destination for people looking to get a good workout - people who wouldn't mind riding here! But, the street layout being what it is, walking here from surrounding neighborhoods is difficult & lengthy. A bike stop might be just the thing!
Biking from UCLA to Expo Line is a major use case! We absolutely need Metro Bike there!
I Agree! Great for Hamilton high!
Close to the Helms Bakery District dining and shopping. Perfect.
I Agree! Next to vons and other errands and not far from expo station palms!
I Agree! Next to vons and other errands and not far from expo station palms!
I Agree, Claremont Village makes for a great place to ride a bike. Lots of shops, restaurants, etc., not to mention the college campuses.
easy location to set up. park, community center, near residential area.
On Occidental or La Fayette Park Place between Beverly and Third St.  This is an extremely hi-density area, and might do very well in this location.
I Agree Rio Park would be rad!

the Glendale train station should be thee first place in all Glendale for metro to place their first bike rental space. its serviced by metrolink, numerous Glendale beeline buses and metro buses all with bike racks and space!.
Great location. I'd use this three or four times a week.

This will be very convenient for people traveling to this section of campus and USC village. There should also be plenty of space for docks to be installed at the northeast corner of Jefferson and Hoover

There are many USC owned locations around DTLA that could allow students, faculty and staff to use bikeshare to move about them easily - IF Metro Bike shares are actually installed at these locations.  USC Park Campus location is the foundation of all these. Do it :) !
Great location near new USC Village
Please add a bike kiosk here!
There’s also a bike shop on the corner of Sunset Blvd and Echo Park Ave, as well as several bus stops including one for the Rapid 704.
Perfect spot for access to Elysian and Echo Park
there's a Metro Redline and Metro Rapid Bus here
I Agree - Rail to Bike is sometimes more practical than Rail to Bus.
NW corner of Fig/23rd St. Great location space wise and near Expo Line.  Area of unused concrete next to sidewalk.
Yes! This location connects a lot of residences with the Red Line and transit hub of Vermont/Sunset.
Can assist those exiting this expo line station
I Agree - There should be more stations along the Figueroa 110 corridor - for rides to USC and the Silverline/Expo line stations.
Close to Expo Line and museums
I Agree! Really nice way to connect to the Vermont/Sunset station -- particularly if you miss the DASH.
I agree with Samantha. I bike to this bus stop and take the 733, but its bike racks sometimes fill up, at which point I have to wait for the next bus. It is also along bike lanes on Venice.
I Agree connect Silver lake and sunset junction to the red line

Close to lassens and little doms both of which lack their own parking. Get people on bikes and cars off the road. Improve pedestrian safety and reduce congestion on the roads. Make it easy to connect to the red line, 780, and the other lines that corral around Sunset and Vermont. Makes a 20-25 min walk into a less than 10 min bike ride

A station here could also make it easier to get from this north-central part of Los Feliz to the 780 Rapid stops at Vermont/Prospect and Los Feliz/Riverside. Although the 780 passes through here, the stops are just too far away for it to be useful for people going to or from the Los Feliz/Hillhurst vicinity.
at the Vermont triangle yes! makes total logic for the area as it wont take away parking from all the local shops. lets put the triangle to use!
Very accessible, close to Los feliz Village and Vermont/Sunset station.
I Agree, Sounds a like a logical location.
Parking is a huge issue at 365.  A bike share would be great so I wouldn't have to drive and fight the parking madness.
Heavily used Metro stop, plus close to LACC and many establishments that would benefit from bike traffic!

Do not put a bike station on Melbourne Avenue as it has the most congested traffic and least space. It should be farther away from apartment buildings and neighborhoods and more located near the hospital / metro station.
Every Metro Rail station should have a bike station nearby.
Very accessible, close to Los afeliz Village and Vermont/Sunset station
Great way to connect residents to metro stations since we don't have them in our neighborhood.
Great way to connect residents to metro stations since we don't have them in our neighborhood.
Great way to connect residents to metro stations since we don't have them in our neighborhood.
Great way to connect residents to metro stations since we don't have them in our neighborhood.

Also near the major bus lines
I agree, this is a good jumping off point for the bridge to Atwater or going around the reservoir.
perfect spot! Silverlake needs more transit options and biking would be so fantastic
Please add a bike share station here! Transit in Silverlake is limited and this could fill in the gaps!
Good location as near residential and commercial facilities.
Would probably fit best on the south side of Sunset at the beginning of Allison Ave, there’s space there for docks.
I Agree because it benefits to commuters.
El Monte Station, gateway transit village
I agree. This is also a good place for first mile/last-mile options between the Metro stop at Wilshire & Western and housing south of the stop.
This is a good location that offers access to the many businesses on Western between 7th and Olympic

550 people live/work at the Brewery Arts Complex and another 100 at nearby Big Arts Labs. And there is a main UPS distribution center with a customer service desk. All would be users of a Metro bike rack.
would love to see one by the Brewery!
Please add a bike station in Lincoln Heights near the L.A. Brewery.
Lots of young artsy people at the Brewery
I Agree! Adding the this metro bike share location would help to make it easier for me to commute from the Lincoln height train station to my ultimate destination.
Yes, this would be great, especially adjacent to the Bicycle Kitchen at Virgil and Fountain.
I Agree but this needs to happen along with changes to make koreatown more bike-friendly

I Agree This area needs a bikeshare station in anticipation of the new station going in this area. There will be a long gap between the Western and La Brea station that will need this station to meet the first/ last mile option the Metro is pushing.
I Agree. Also at Trader Joe's.
Lots of people in this neighborhood walk and bike. A bike share would help our many residents who already don't have cars get to nearby grocery stores and parks.
Every metro stop should have a bike station!
I Agree  bikeshare at all of the PLE stations please
We need this program in Koreatown
Every metro station should have bike share. Especially along the dense Purple Line corridor, and ESPECIALLY in dense Koreatown.
Bike share at all Purple Line stops make sense especially while we wait for the line extension
Expanding to Koreatown should be a priority for the system.
This street is such a great example of LA's incredible food and diversity - let's make it easier for folks to get to without a car!
A bike station here would be more convenient than taking the bus or walking to the expo line. During rush hour it can take 30 min plus on the bus to get to the station, 20 min walking.
If we are going to have green ways to get to and from the subway station then this should be a no brainer to make sure we have bike share at the edge of these venues.
Private companies are going to beat metro to this area
I Agree. Highland Park Gold Line Station is a excellent location for this service.
I Agree, easy to move around
Highland Park Gold Line is a perfect connection point for bikeshare users.
I Agree. Bike-Share in LA County will likely work great if it can be used as legitimate first/last mile tool to get to and from Metro stations.
Great location for Gold Line access and to bike to York.
The Highland Park - Gold Line Station would help drive more people to visit Figueroa businesses without bringing in more cars. There would be more adoption of bike lanes on figueroa.
The highland park Gold line station is very busy and used by a very mixed group of people
Yes, these schools could use 1 or 2 bike stations.
Yes a station or 2 in the DT Pomona area.
Huge usage by the red line metro users
Every Metro Rail station should have a bike station like this nearby, then one at every nearby park or landmark will help tourism.
There are 800 + potential users right here in one location!
This location also has some very tall pine trees that provide shade.
This location is in front of the Bikerowave, a community bike shop, and would be a great place for a station that could influence potential riders to use the system.
I Agree!!! Connects with several bus lines that stop here
Yes please! Perfect for Ciclavia too
Would love to see one here!
We need more bike share locations in residential areas so people can easily pick up a bike close to where they live.
As much as possible, bike share stations should be placed at all rail stations.
Expo Line complements this bike station.
I Agree!! Bus stop, near high school, and great street protected bike lane.
This is an important station because it allows the use of bikeshare to provide an east-west connection to the Big Blue Bus 3/Rapid 3 route.
I Agree, please lets have a park!
Please provide more than one station, Sony is large and has multiple entrances.
Great to get Sony folks out of their car for short errands!
I Agree, right next to my job - Sony!
Sepulveda and Venice is a major transportation hub for busses, and it lies along a well-marked bike route to the Expo Culver station in one direction, and Venice Beach in the other.

I Agree - Venice Blvd. is a main artery for bicycling from the beach to downtown.  The intersection of Venice & Sepulveda is a major intersection for buses and the 405.  A must have spot for bike sharing.
This location is perfect for me because I could ride TO this location for my errands or coffee.
I Agree - great location next to trader joes and other retail
This would also be next to the bike lanes.  Easy ride to Beverly Hills.
Also, easy bike ride to the office from expo line.
It is kind of awkward to have to over-shoot or stop short of a hub like LA Live to use the bike share to get (most of the way) there.

There needs to be a bike rack at or near LA Live. It would service residents who work or play at LA Live, those that take the metro into DTLA to get to Staples Center/LA Live and hotel guests around campus. It's a huge miss not to have a station here.
Also useful for getting to the theater.
No one wants to bring their own bike to the stadium and risk theft. But Dodgers traffic is no joke. This is an amazing idea for a location!!

I Agree. Yes agree on a location near the stadium. People can take the Goldline and get off the Chinatown station and then use the bikes there and bike to the park. Then vice versa after the game. IT'd be really convenient for many people going to the game.
I Agree. Would be great to ride a bike share bike which can be secured instead of riding my own bike and worrying about locking it.
I Agree.  This would help connect people to the Chinatown GL station.
I Agree. The one on Alameda is too small given the demand.
I Agree... union station is really missing one near the bus hub. could help also when Alameda docks are full
There should definitely be one at the back of Union Station too, to serve the bus terminal.
There's already a bike station out front.
I Agree, maybe integrate with the new shopping plaza happening on swarthmore in the coming years?
I Disagree, not a lot of bike infrastructure in the area and sunset is a real barrier for bikes and pedestrians. No space to ride here, unless only in the neighborhood.
I Agree, plus there's a local school that bike share could be good for.
This is convenient to many shops and a lot of housing in the Runway complex
I Agree. Would be a great addition and would assist everyone based here to get to and from Downtown.
I Agree.  More bikes on the river trail!
I Agree, but you should consider moving this a couple blocks to the east
Close to apartments.  Close to malls, ucla area, metro line.
I strongly agree. This location has access to all the locations on campus.
I Agree. If you add a bike station here, I and my husband will buy a monthly pass every month. Current stations are not suitable for USC students.

In the middle of campus would be a bad idea. The campus closes after 9 PM, thus not accessible to the public. It is private property, just try to get the university to give up some real estate. It would negatively effect the aesthetics of the campus. Place the bikes just off campus.
USC students love biking! This would be a great spot to connect campus to different residences and entertainment options in DTLA.
I would use bikeshare between USC and downtown
USC would be perfect for bike share, both around campus and a quick way to connect to downtown
I Agree. Need some on Temple! Huge artery.
Have a new office in the area and would like to get a bike from the rail station
Use this station a lot. Jefferson has some new commercial activity and would love to have a bike station here.
This area is beginning to boom with new commercial. I would use these bikes every day
I Disagree.  Glendale is a death trap.  No one will use these bikes.
There's proposed lane changes to make it easier to bike in this area.
This would be a great place to have a bike share station!
The more stations especially if it's in residential areas the better
Great location with lots of retail, dining, grocery store, etc.
SM Bus 8 turns here and there is a church, donut shop, bank, Trader Joe's, and synagogue at this corner. It is also down the street from a popular park (Palms/Rancho Park).
Perfect for connection from bus stops to both culver and palms neighborhoods
A bike share station that would allow you.to get on/off the LA River bike trail could turn it into a bike highway for commuters.
Biking downtown for work from Los Feliz would be ideal!
If there is an area that has a high concentration of housing units, such as a large apt bldg., it'd be good to locate a station close to there.
The map shows stations at each intersection along Motor Ave, however, they are all shown on the East side of Motor.  I think, if practical, they should alternate sides of the street.
Good to have bike share by the school and the market
So close to my house, yes please!
I Agree, this is a good location
I Agree, bikes in/at the park.

I Agree. This will go beautifully with the arroyo seco pedestrian trail being constructed here and would also provide s great way to go hit some golf balls (or tennis balls- the racquet center is always struggling for parking)
YES!  There is great bike riding down here (and the bike path in the Arroyo.  Also will allow people to bike to and from the Gold line station.
Definitely a crucial place for a bike share station, it would get a ton of use
A bike share station at the Expo station and another in the new development being built in the former parking lot.
absolutely needed at Expo Station/Ivy Station/Expo Bike Path
Definitely makes sense to have a bike share hub at the Culver City Expo Line Metro station.
I Agree. More Bikes near UCLA please! Dense area full of students who don't have cars.

This area of West L.A. has no bike stations, and yet, we also have no parking at the Metro station, rendering it useless to those of us in the area! This is an excellent central location a bike station, and my many apartment-dwelling neighbors and I would be so relieved to not have to drive to wherever we need to go in West L.A., Westwood, and Rancho Park!

I strongly agree. This is a bustling area with several very popular restaurants, take-just and bars. It is densely populated by USC students, who would greatly benefit from being able to ride to USC every morning. This is also an area that is, for the moment, completely un-covered by the Metro bikeshare.
I Agree. Highly populated. Close to USC and downtown.
I Agree, convenient for short trips between shops and USC
close to many businesses frequented by USC community
Bikes in this location would provide much needed access to Union Station.
Please add a bike location. There would be a lot of people who would use it here.
Many bike riders here who frequently go to and from the Arts District and other areas of DTLA.
Biking to the Sunset/ Vermont redline station from this far out would be much better than walking.
Perfect for connecting to retail from Purple Line and 720 bus stops
I Agree - This would be a terrific first & last mile solution to get to and from the Metro station at Vermont/Santa Monica
